headline: Program Management Officer at ICE Health Service Corps
summary: Experienced Program Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the Public Health - Administrative Operations. Skilled in Policy Analysis, Analytical Skills, Government, Data Analysis, and Program Evaluation. Strong program and project management professional pursuing doctoral degree from West Chester University of Pennsylvania.

positions.title: Program Management Officer/Contract Officer's Representative

positions.description:
â¢ Directly supervised 17 GS 9-15 staff and reported to a SES member
â¢ Principal advisor for all human capital related activities for a Center with over 450 FTEs (over 50% of the employees are classified as bargaining unit) and an annual appropriation ~$1.67B
â¢ Planned, organized and facilitated Center-wide operational initiatives and programs to support all recruitment and retention functions, including FTE tracking, training & development initiatives, ITAS/VLTP programs, Interagency Agreements (IAAs), Intergovernmental Personnel Agreements (IPAs), Employee Viewpoint Survey (EVS), manager and employee engagement programs, performance management and workforce planning data analytics
â¢ Oversight for the $4.79M INSPIRE contract (STEM-based temporary support contract to supplement recruitment efforts by providing additional talent to meet skill gaps in Centerâs workforce) 
â¢ Managed leased-facility building, daily operations, space management, renovations, correspondence, clearance, FOIAs, Regulations, Reports to Congress, and emergency preparedness planning and Continuity of Operations (COOP)
positions.title: Director, Executive Operations Staff

positions.description:
â¢ CMS/Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation (CMMI) Annual appropriation is ~$1.67B with 425 FTEs.
â¢ Worked directly with CMMI Deputy Director for Operations (SES position) with development of management policy impacting the entire Center.
â¢ Served as an expert consultant/senior advisor to the Center Senior Leadership Team.
â¢ Lead for all human capital management activities for 425 FTEs. Directly responsible for oversight of HR and onboarding team to recruit and retain the right team for the Center.
â¢ Implemented employee engagement actions plans to align with strategic direction working with Senior Leaders. 
â¢ Lead for the Continuity of Operations (COOP) program for the Center.
positions.title: Executive Officer

positions.companyName: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
positions.description:
â¢ Lead for Workforce Engagement Team which provides ongoing oversight, evaluation, and analysis of policies and programs, such as WDS Emergency Preparedness and Continuity of Operations (COOP), Title 42 and 38 Compensation, Performance (Executive, PMAP, and Commissioned Corps), Monetary and Non-monetary Awards Programs, Employee Surveys, WDS Intranet and Internet, and NHLBI Recognition Budget.
â¢ Served as a COR for Senior Leadership Change Management Blanket Purchase Agreement with multiple task orders.
â¢ Works directly with senior management officials to interpret research, evaluate, and create policies and procedures for the Institute (over 900 FTEs and annual appropriation of $3.08B), and organizes and facilitates Institute-wide and/or NIH-wide administrative management programs and projects.
positions.title: Lead Management Analyst

positions.companyName: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health
